Taylor, Diana, Spanish and Portuguese | NYU                                Navigation           NEW YORK UNIVERSITY       ARTS AND SCIENCE       COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE       GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                              Back to Home               Diana Taylor     Professor of Spanish and Portuguese   - Ph.D. 1981 (Comparative Literature), University of Washington; M.A. 1974 (Comparative Literature), National University of Mexico; Certificat d'Etudes Superieures 1972, Universite Aix-Marseille; B.A. 1971 (Creative Writing), University of the Americas, Mexico     Office Address: 721 Broadway, 6th Floor     Email:       Personal Homepage: http://hemi.nyu.edu       External Affiliations:   Editorial Board work has included: PMLA (Publication of the Modern Language Association) , Review: Literature and Arts in the Americas (America's Society), TDR , Theatre Journal , Theatre Research International , among others.     Areas of Research/Interest: Latin American and U.S. theatre and performance, performance and politics, feminist theatre and performance in the Americas, Hemispheric studies, trauma studies.     Select Publications:   The Archive and the Repertoire: Performing Cultural Memory in the Americas . Durham: Duke University Press, Forthcoming (2003).    Disappearing Acts: Spectacles of Gender and Nationalism in Argentina's Dirty War . Durham: Duke University Press. 1997. Theatre of Crisis: Drama and Politics in Latin America . Lexington: University Press of Kentucky. 1991.    Edited Books: Stages of Conflict: A Reader of Latin American Theatre and Performance . Ann Arbor: Michigan University Press, Forthcoming (2004). Holy Terrors: Latin American Women Perform . Durham: Duke University Press, Forthcoming (2003). Co-edited with Roselyn Costantino). Defiant Acts: Four Plays by Diana Raznovich . Lewisburg: Bucknell University Press, 2002. (Co-edited with Martínez Victoria). The Politics of Motherhood: Activist Voices from Left to Right, co-editor, with Annelise Orleck and Alexis Jetter. Hanover: University Press of New England. Negotiating Performance: Gender, Sexuality and Theatricality in Latin/o America , editor, with Juan Villegas. Durham: Duke University Press. 1994. En busca de una imagen: El arquitecto y el emperador de arisia y Cementerio de automóviles , editor. Ottawa: Girol Books. 1989. Fernando Arrabal: El arquitecto y el emperador de asiria y Cementerio de automoviles . Madrid: Cátedra, 1984. Articles have appeared in: The Drama Review , Theatre Journal , Performance Arts Journal , MLQ , Latin American Theatre Review .
